definition: abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)

sentences.english: Light ship-of-the-line has around fifty heavy cannons on two decks.
sentences.chinese: 轻型战列舰在两层甲板上有大约50门中型加农炮。

sentences.english: The cannons were found in 2008 and recovered last year.
sentences.chinese: 这些加农炮与2008年被发现并于去年出土。

sentences.english: Zheng Jianong, a bulldozer driver, has been suffering from illness for years and his wife leaves him.
sentences.chinese: 推土车司机郑加农因常年受病痛所困，妻子离他而去。

sentences.english: You can also position the cannon's angle using the mouse.
sentences.chinese: 您还可以使用滑鼠定位加农炮的角度。

sentences.english: His Shockwave Cannon wheeled about and exploded raw air.
sentences.chinese: 他的“冲击波加农炮”出场发射空炮。

sentences.english: These fearsome beasts have small cannons, comparable to serpentines, mounted on their backs.
sentences.chinese: 这些恐怖巨兽背负著类似蛇炮的小型加农炮。

definition: to prepare herbal medicine by roasting or parching (in a pan)
to sauté/to fry/to dry by heating
Rodan (Japanese ラドン Radon), Japanese movie monster
big gun/cannon/artillery/one who talks big/trad. form 大炮 also used/CL:門|门[men2],尊[zun1]
positron/also called 正電子|正电子[zheng4 dian4 zi3]
